page.title: 18CHANGING TIMES: WALSALL WOOD
page.content: A group of 5th formers from The Shire Oak School visited Streets Corner Day Centre for the elderly. They asked the old people about how life has changed since their youth. The general opinion was that today's generation were materially better off and had greater educational opportunities. People no longer had to enter the Workhouse, share clothes, go without holidays or leave school before 14. However, not all changes were regarded as improvements. The old people suggested that neighbourliness had declined, and that growing violence and unemployment, as well as increasing traffic, had made life less pleasant than formerly. Some also commented unfavourably on the masculine nature of today's women and the threat to work posed by robots.
